Text.Value: *You seem to have rather aggravated the situation. The guards are being summoned.*
*You may want to move on, but the witness doesn't. The guards are on their way.*
*It seems you owe compensation for the item you just damaged.* ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

EditorData.logicalname: Owner of vandalised item, not angry

Text.Value: *You sense you just damaged something rather personal. An action you might come to regret.*
*Vandalising someone else's belongings wasn't your wisest decision. But it might be your last.*
*It seems the owner of that item was rather attached to it. You're about to face the consequences.*
No use crying over it, is there?
Things break. Get over it.
Attack.
*Perhaps you shouldn't go around vandalising things. It seems to make people want to kill you.*
*Vandals aren't tolerated around here. You're about to find out what happens to them.*
*Destruction of property is taken rather seriously around here. Time to defend yourself.*

EditorData.logicalname: Not owner of vandalised item, NOT_MESSING_AROUND

Text.Value: I don't have that kind of gold.
I can't afford that.
Attack.
*Your intention matters far less than the outcome. The guards will deal with this.*
*Your contrition isn't enough. The guards will decide your punishment.*
*Your cavalier attitude to personal property is not always shared. For instance, this witness seems rather put out by your vandalism.*
*You won't get away with vandalism around here. This witness will make sure of it. As will the guards.*
*A witness saw you damaging someone else's property. It seems the guards are about to be called.*

EditorData.logicalname: Not owner of vandalised item, angry

Text.Value: *Your attitude might impress some, but it won't get you far here. Perhaps the guards will appreciate it.*
*You should save your arguments for the guards. It's getting you nowhere at the moment.*
*You were seen vandalising someone else's property. Perhaps you should smooth things over.*
*Your vandalism has been spotted. An explanation is in order.*
*You damaged something that wasn't yours. You sense trouble brewing.*
No use crying over it, is there?
Things break. Get over it.
Attack.
Fair enough. Here you go.
All right, I'll pay for it.
*Breaking things is a lot of fun. What's less fun is when their owner threatens to call the guards.*
*Your destructive tendencies have landed you in trouble. It looks like the owner is about to summon the guards.*
*You've paid the price for your vandalism. The matter is resolved.*
*You never knew vandalism could prove so costly. Perhaps next time you'll be more careful.*
*Your apology is reluctantly accepted.*
*You manage to calm the situation down. Though next time, it may not be so simple.*
*You refused to pay. Unfortunately, that means this is a matter for the guards.*
*Your refusal to pay has done you few favours. It will be left to the guards to loosen your purse strings.*
Apologies! I meant no harm.
But - but - it was an accident!
Forgive me. I assure you it wasn't intentional.
Apologies! I meant no harm.
But - but - it was an accident!
Forgive me. I assure you it wasn't intentional.
You're not getting a penny from me.
I don't think so.

Synopsis:
A player damaged or destroyedf an item owned by an NPC, and an NPC (the owner or someone else) witnessed this and stops the player by starting this dialog.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim (= owner) or a witness of the crime.
